access: A character who is a member of the Hellknights has access to Hellknight breastplate.
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Hellknight Breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=23)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 10 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 10 gp

**AC Bonus** +4

**Dex Cap** +1

**Check Penalty** -2

**Speed Penalty** -5 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 16

**Bulk** 2

**Category** Medium

**Group** Plate
</row>

</column>

---

Hellknights wear a variety of armors decorated with designs specific to the order. Hellknight breastplate serves those in the order who lack the training to wear heavy armor. 

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-4" />
name: Hellknight Breastplate
